item.title: xz integration
item.description: thanks colliins...and one question regardiing lzma2 code, 7z and xz both are using diffrent lzma2 code, is these both codes are developed on same code base, i want to integrate 7z lzma2 code base to xz codse base, is it possible..? as of now ihave breifly gone through both code bases, data structures are different..anybody..soome point..?
item.dc:creator: kranthiH

item.title: xz integration
item.description:
xz doesn't write compressed data to a terminal. gzip and bzip2 behave similarly. It is mostly to prevent simple mistakes from messing up the terminal. It is (probably) never useful to write compressed data to a terminal.

What operating system are you using? On POSIXish OSes I would be surprised if xz has a problem here, but perhaps on Windows the terminal detection (isatty()) doesn't work correctly for some types of file descriptors. If so, such a problem should be fixed or worked around in some way.
item.dc:creator: Lasse Collin

item.title: xz integration
item.description:
Hi,

Iam trying integrate xz code my zip, while trying compress given input file, it is showing that stdooout is terminal, so throwing error. but with xz open source environment it is working properlly, please suuggest me any settings or macros to be defined for this..reviewed the xz code.

in case open sooource debug environment stdout is set to some new destination file,
but in my enviroonment it is setting stdout to terminal..

but both cases my user input is same : char *szSrc[] = {"xz", "-c", "1.txt"," > ", "1.txt.xz"};

Please clarify this problem
item.dc:creator: kranthiH
